info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:30AM EST until January 14 at 7:45AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND...EAST CENTRAL GREENE AND FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 729 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Black Lick to near Scottdale to near Fairdale, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 76 and 99. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 13. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Latrobe, Connellsville, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Masontown, McChesneytown-Loyalhanna, Youngwood, Derry, Lawson Heights, Brownsville, New Stanton, South Connellsville, Perryopolis, Ligonier, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Seven Springs, Fairchance, and Calumet-Norvelt. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
